As an Android developer, what better way to show you who I am and what I do than through an app! Here is a little bit about me and why I do what I do:
Software is the coolest and fastest way to bring an idea to life. I made my first game in Grade 10 using Turing, and have pretty much been hooked ever since.
Apps are the most personal way to reach a user… they live in peoples\' pockets! Me any pretty much everyone I know can’t get enough apps, so I couldn’t help but want to make some good ones.
I love the fact that Android provides beautiful experiences on so many different phones, and gives developers a means of reaching such a vast, international audience.
It took me some time before realizing remote work was for me… but now I know that I need the freedom to travel, work on my schedule and go beyond the standard 9–5 job!
Am a native English speaker who has been talking code since age 13.
Convey complicated technical matters to developers and non-technical associates.
Am connected at all times; through Skype, email and even directly via cell phone.
With over 5 years in the industry, I\'ve gained valuable experience and insight into how we use software to solve our world\'s problems.
I set very high working standards for myself, remain adaptable to shifting business needs and do whatever it takes to get the job done.
build one from the ground up
extend and build off general requirements
work with detailed specs and style guides
utilize my own time when possible
learn new technologies to apply better ones
I strive to create the best experience Android has to offer by building completely native apps the way they are supposed to be built!
I work strictly with Google tools and guidelines to produce native Android apps.
I refine the user experience based on Android UI Design Principles for all screen sizes.
I utilize the open-source Android ecosystem with 3rd party library integration.
I can extend an Android app with real-time backend services like Firebase & Parse.
Integrating Google Analytics to track and leverage usage and user interaction data.
Finally I can ship the final product onto the Google Play Store.
I never stop exploring the open-source world for great libraries to use; here are the ones I have worked with so far:
Select a library to learn a little bit about it!

string-array.name: a_networking_libs_info
string-array.item: Google\'s HTTP library that makes networking for Android apps easier and most importantly, faster.
A type-safe REST client for Android which intelligently maps an API into a client interface using annotations.
A powerful image downloading and caching library for Android that will abstract the complexity behind an easy to use DSL.

string-array.name: a_application_libs_info
string-array.item: An event bus created for easier, simpler inter-component communication in Android apps, especially between Activities, Fragments, and threads.
Powerful extensions to Android that allow developers to inject dependencies for views, resources, system services, and any other objects.
A framework that speeds up Android development and facilitates code maintenance by keeping syntax simple.

string-array.name: a_storage_libs_info
string-array.item: A lightweight wrapper around SQLiteOpenHelper which brings reactive stream semantics to SQL operations.
Secure Simple Key-Value Storage for Android that provides secure data persistence for any type.
An Android persistence library that allows you to persist a JSON object tree directly into an SQLite database through OrmLite.

string-array.name: a_interface_libs_info
string-array.item: An Android library which provides custom views and widgets styled according to the Twitter Bootstrap Specification.
A library for creating dynamic and static charts in your Android app, everything from scatter plots to candlestick charts.
An easy image cropping library developed by Lyft, with built-in support for Picasso, Glide or Universal Image Loader.

string-array.name: a_testing_libs_info
string-array.item: A UI test framework (part of the Android Testing Support Library) that allows you to create automated UI tests for your Android app.
A unit testing framework that allows Android applications to be tested on the JVM without an emulator or device.
